Dear Stephanie Rae Sears:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Staff member improperly restrained a youth by using a choke
hold.
Investigation It was alleged Staff 1 inappropriately used physical intervention
with Youth A during an incident at the facility.
Interviews:
I interviewed MDHHS Worker by phone on 1/7/2025. MDHHS
Worker stated an on-call worker visited Youth A and determined
there were no apparent injuries to Youth A. MDHHS Worker
stated the mother of Youth A had reportedly attempted to have
Youth A visit the emergency room, but Youth A refused to go. I
also scheduled interviews with MDHHS Worker at the facility for
1/13/2025.
I interviewed Complainant at the facility with MDHHS Worker on
1/13/2025. Complainant reported he was notified of the incident
when Complainant was contacted by Independent Living
Supervisor (ILP) and Youth A sent Complainant a text.
Complainant stated the police had been contacted and were
already at the location when Complainant arrived. Complainant
stated the police reported Youth A as the aggressor in the
incident. Complainant reported Staff 1 had a bite mark on Staff
1's hand and arm. Complainant stated Staff 1 was sent home
following Staff 1's completion of an incident report. Complainant
stated Staff 1 never returned to work following the incident and the
employment of Staff 1 was subsequently terminated. Complainant
reported he did observe a small bruise behind the left ear and
neck of Youth A but Complainant couldn't confirm they were the
result of the incident. Complainant stated the behavior
management policy of the agency does not include the use of
physical management by staff members.
I interviewed Youth A with MDHHS Worker at the facility on
1/13/2025. Youth A stated Youth A does feel safe at the facility.
Youth A stated Youth A was standing in the doorway of another
participant's room. Youth A stated Staff 1 directed Youth A to go
to Youth A's room and not stand in the doorway. Youth A reported
not complying with the instruction of Staff 1 and then Staff 1
grabbed the arm of Youth A and Youth A hit Staff 1 twice. Youth
A reported there was subsequently a struggle between Youth A
and Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 1 choked Youth A during the
struggle and threw Youth A against a desk. Youth A reported
Youth B contacted the police, and the police took a statement.
Youth A stated Youth B and Youth C were witnesses to the
2

incident. Youth A stated Youth A's mother took Youth A following
the incident to get away for a while. Youth A stated Youth A's
mother tried to take Youth A to the emergency room, but Youth A
refused to go until three days later. Youth A described Staff 1 as
too controlling/authoritative leading up to the incident. Youth A
stated there is a policy that residents are not allowed to be in the
room of other residents. Youth A reported behavior management
policy of the agency does not include physical intervention.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility with MDHHS Worker on
1/13/2025. Youth B described the incident similar to the
description reported by Youth A. Youth B reported feeling safe at
the facility. Youth B reported not seeing any injuries to Youth A
following the incident. Youth B reported behavior management
policy of the agency does not include physical intervention.
I interviewed Youth C at the facility with MDHHS Worker on
1/13/2025. Youth C described the incident similar to the
description reported by Youth A and Youth B. Youth C reported
not observing any injuries to Youth A following the incident. Youth
C reported the behavior management policy of the agency does
not include physical intervention.
I interviewed Independent Living Plus (ILP) Supervisor at the
facility with MDHHS Worker on 1/13/2025. ILP Supervisor
confirmed contacting Complainant regarding the incident, but was
not a witness and did not have any additional information.
MDHHS Worker interviewed Staff 1 and reported Staff 1 denied
choking or hitting Youth A during the incident/struggle. MDHHS
Worker also reported the police statement that was completed did
not indicate any injuries to Youth A. The incident report
completed by Staff 1 indicated Staff 1 attempted to physically
move Youth A from the doorway of another youth by grabbing
Youth A. Youth A then struck Staff 1 and it escalated into a
physical fight/wrestling with Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
Incident Report completed by Complainant dated 1/4/2025. The
information/description was consistent with interviews.
Incident Report completed by Staff 1 dated 1/4/2025. The
information/description was consistent with interviews.
3

Urgent Care Medical/Discharge Report for Youth A dated
1/07/2025. The findings did not confirm any injuries as a result of
the incident.
Agency Employment Termination Letter for Staff 1 dated
1/13/2025. Documented Staff 1's termination of employment
effective 1/13/2025. Staff 1 was still in a probationary period and
was terminated as a result of this incident.
Personnel Record of Staff 1. Provided documentation of
employment from 12/9/2024 to 1/13/2025.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 did participate in
an inappropriate physical intervention/altercation with Youth A in
violation of the agency's behavior management policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
